document.topic_text: Home / Crime / Crime In Hyderabad (22.8.2016) Crime In Hyderabad (22.8.2016) August 22, 2016 Crime , Crime in Hyderabad Leave a comment Minor dies in wall collapse (Siasat News): In a tragic incident occurred in a house situated at Zafar Road in Yakutpura, a minor aged one and half years died when the wall of the septic tank accidentally collapsed. The deceased Mohd. Talha was playing on the first floor of the house at the time of the accident. He was crushed under the collapsed wall and died instantly. This accident sent shock waves in the locality. Police has registered a case. Woman ends life (Siasat News): A woman, who just could not bear the taunts of her husband and his second wife for remaining issueless, committed suicide. Sub-inspector Malakpet police station Mr. Venkat Ram Reddy said that the deceased Nareen, 20 got married to one Ratlawat Thayu some seven years ago but the couple remained issueless. Thayu, in the meantime, got married for the second time. However, he along with his second wife used to taunt his first wife for not producing any child. When their insulting behavior became unbearable, she took the extreme step of ending her life. A case has been registered and further investigations are on. Urge for sweet proved fatal for a boy (Siasat News): A 12-year-old boy in Jagatgirigutta met with a ghastly road accident when he was with his father to buy some sweets. As per the details, one Abdul Aziz s/o Abdul Madaar, a security officer in a bank in Nizamabad, had reached Jagatgirigutta to meet his family members. After reaching there Abdul Aziz insisted upon his father Abdul Madaar that he wanted to eat sweets. Giving in to his pressure, Abdul Madaar took him to the market on his bike. But the fate had something otherwise. As soon as they came on the main road, a speeding water tanker severely hit their bike killing Abdul Aziz on the spot whereas Abdul Madaar was seriously injured and admitted in the hospital. Kukatpally police has registered a case and further investigations are in progress. Parent’s reprimand led the girl to suicide (Siasat News): A girl in Maheshwaram who was reprimanded by her parents for falling in love with a boy in such a minor age, committed suicide. It is said that the deceased Krishnaveni, 15, was the student of Intermediate and was in love with a boy Praveen. However, her parents did not like this and reprimanded her to mend her ways. Seeing the negative attitude of her parents Krishnaveni along with Praveen decided to commit suicide and the duo brought some pesticide to their house. Krishnaveni was the first to consume the poison and when Praveen was about to consume it, her parents entered the scene. Seeing them Praveen immediately fled leaving Krishnaveni in pains that later proved fatal. A case has been registered and further investigations are underway.
